result.execSummary:
The defendant JASON ALAN GRAY was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Amphetamine (>50g), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)4.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is eligible for both the Substance Abuse Program and the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Concurrent with:

superMiscConds.notes: The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.   Penalty for non-payment shall be entry of civil judgment.   Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees.  Send payments to:  Clerk of Courts, Room 110, 415 Jackson Street, P O Box 2808, Oshkosh WI  54903-2808.

State argues for 3-4 yrs incarceration/3-4 years extended supervision.  Defense argues 2 yr incarceration/2 yrs extended supervision.  Defendant advised of and waives rights.  Enters plea freely and voluntarily and proceeds to sentencing.  Victim/Witness rights complied with.  Defendant makes sentencing statement.  Parties waive right to Presentence Investigation Report.
